content.description: <math alttext="O 2, H 2 O, C 3 H 8, C F 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>8</mn></msub><mo>,</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mi>CF</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>
content.question: Of the substances listed above, which has the highest boiling point, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, because its molecules have a double bond between the oxygen atoms.

<math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>, because hydrogen bonds form between its molecules.

<math alttext="C 3 H 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>8</mn></msub></math>, because multiple hydrogen bonds can form between its molecules.

<math alttext="C F 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>CF</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>, because its molecules have the largest dipole moment, since <math alttext="carbon to fluorine single" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo lspace="0.05em" rspace="0.05em">-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi></math> bonds are highly polar.

content.answer: <math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></math>, because hydrogen bonds form between its molecules.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
